articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russia would cease fire and enter peace talks if Ukraine dropped its NATO ambitions and withdrew its forces from four Ukrainian regions claimed by Moscow.
articles.title: Putin says Russia will cease fire if Ukraine pulls troops from four regions

articles.author: Dave Graham, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: World leaders will join Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy at a summit this weekend to explore ways of ending the deadliest conflict in Europe since World War Two, but Russia isn't invited and the event will fall short of Kyiv's aim of isolating Moscow.
articles.title: Ukraine summit attracts world leaders but fails to isolate Russia

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Group of Seven (G7) leaders hold a final day of talks at their annual summit on Friday, with China topping the agenda before Pope Francis puts in a historic appearance to discuss artificial intelligence (AI).
articles.title: China to dominate final day of G7, Pope to lead AI discussions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Senior officials of South Korea and the United States held an emergency phone call over a possible impending visit by Russian President Vladimir Putin to North Korea, Seoul's foreign ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: South Korea, US warn against North Korea-Russia military ties ahead of Putin visit

articles.author: Sinead Cruise
articles.description: Private banks and advisers to Britain's super-rich say some clients may quit the country if Labour wins next month's general election and pushes ahead with plans to abolish tax protections on offshore wealth they wanted to pass to future generations.
articles.title: Super-rich may quit UK over Labour plans for inheritance taxes on trusts

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China's "provocative" actions around Taiwan, Japan and in the South China Sea run the risk of an accident that could unintentionally spark a broader conflict, Washington's top diplomat in Taipei said on Friday.
articles.title: Senior US diplomat warns of risks of accidental conflict sparked by China's moves

articles.author: Jose Devasia
articles.description: The bodies of 45 Indians who died in a fire in a labour housing facility in Kuwait were flown to India on Friday, as bereaved relatives and experts urged New Delhi to do more to protect the lives of those who work abroad and send remittances home.
articles.title: India brings home bodies of 45 workers killed in Kuwait fire

articles.author: Wendell Roelf, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South Africa's newly elected parliament convenes on Friday to choose the country's next president with the public still in the dark about which parties will join the African National Congress in government and the policies they will pursue.
articles.title: South Africa parliament convenes as talks on who will govern go down to the wire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's leftwing parties will reveal the political manifesto for their renewed alliance on Friday, which politicians from the bloc said included policies that would lower the retirement age, link salaries to inflation and introduce a wealth tax for the rich.
articles.title: France's left pledges to tie wages to inflation, lower retirement age in new alliance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Demonstrators were due to rally in Athens on Friday to mark the anniversary of a shipwreck that killed hundreds of migrants off Greece and demand answers about the causes of the disaster and the fate of relatives.
articles.title: Greece migrant boat disaster relatives demand answers, one year on
